private_information: I can move only disks A, B, C, D, E.
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk; only the top disk of any peg may be moved.
Available pegs are named left, middle, right.
agent_1.goal: Propose a valid, fully ordered list of primitive moves for disks A, B, C, D, E that contributes to the global goal without moving disks F, G, H, I, J.

private_information: I can move only disks F, G, H, I, J.
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk; only the top disk of any peg may be moved.
Available pegs are named left, middle, right.
agent_2.goal: Propose a valid, fully ordered list of primitive moves involving disks F, G, H, I, J only if necessary to reach the global goal; otherwise emit an empty move list.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency of proposed moves.
I enforce Tower of Hanoi legality, agent-to-disk authorization, and peg naming consistency.
I remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or any non-primitive operations; only primitive moves are allowed.
I ensure the final audited sequence achieves the exact goal configuration.
auditor.goal: Validate and, if needed, reconcile agent_1 and agent_2 proposed moves into a single, legal, chronologically ordered list that transforms the initial configuration into the specified goal configuration, respecting agent restrictions.

private_information: I coordinate agents and compile the final audited plan into a PDDL domain and problem compatible with the Fast Downward solver.
The PDDL must include types (disk, peg, agent), authorization constraints (which agent may move which disk), size ordering, and classic Hanoi preconditions/effects.
The problem must encode the 10-disk initial state and the specified non-standard goal distribution.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and problem that capture the audited plan and legality constraints for the 2-agent Tower of Hanoi with 10 disks, targeting the Fast Downward solver.

public_information: This is a 2-agent Tower of Hanoi with 10 disks labelled A (smallest) through J (largest).
agent_1 may move only disks A, B, C, D, E.
agent_2 may move only disks F, G, H, I, J.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg has (top→bottom) A; right peg has (top→bottom) B, C, D.
All moves must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; only the top disk may be moved; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.

ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk C from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk B from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk D from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk B from middle to left
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk C from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
notes: E through J remain on the left peg throughout; their relative order is preserved.
The final configuration matches the goal: left = E,F,G,H,I,J; middle = A; right = B,C,D.
All moves are performed by agent_1 and respect the authorization and Hanoi legality constraints.

plan.system_prompt: You plan primitive Tower of Hanoi moves for disks A, B, C, D, E only. Respect legality: move one disk at a time; only the top disk may move; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk; use pegs left, middle, right.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Using the public information {environment->public_information} and knowing your authorized disks {environment->init->agent_authorizations->agent_1}, propose an ordered list of primitive moves formatted exactly as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not include any PDDL. Do not move disks F, G, H, I, J. If a concise optimal sequence exists that reaches the goal state, output it; otherwise output the best valid sequence you can construct.

plan.system_prompt: You plan primitive Tower of Hanoi moves for disks F, G, H, I, J only. Respect legality and peg naming.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Using the public information {environment->public_information} and your authorizations {environment->init->agent_authorizations->agent_2}, propose an ordered list of primitive moves formatted exactly as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' only if moving a large disk is necessary. If no large-disk move is required, output an empty list. Do not include any PDDL.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency, ensuring only legal primitive moves remain; you remove any shortcuts or non-primitive operations and enforce agent-to-disk authorization.
audit.prompt: You receive candidate move sequences from agent_1 and agent_2. Verify that each move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules, the initial configuration, and agent-specific disk permissions. Ensure peg names are from {environment->init->pegs}. Produce a single, fully ordered, validated move list that transforms {environment->init->initial_state} into {environment->init->goal_state}. Output only the audited moves, formatted as 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in constructing PDDL domains and problems for Fast Downward. Always output a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem enclosed respectively in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags. Use typed STRIPS with objects for pegs, disks, and agents; encode size ordering via a strict smaller relation; encode authorization via can-move(agent, disk); encode on and clear relations for disks and pegs; and actions move(?a - agent ?d - disk ?from - support ?to - support) with legality preconditions and correct effects. The problem must reflect the 10-disk initial state and the specified non-standard goal. Ensure compatibility with Fast Downward (no unsupported features).
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Integrate the audited move sequence {audited_moves} with the public information {environment->public_information} and the initialization data {environment->init}. Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for the 2-agent Tower of Hanoi with 10 disks A..J and pegs {environment->init->pegs}. Include agents agent_1 and agent_2, with authorization facts matching {environment->init->agent_authorizations}. The initial state must encode the left peg stack A (top) .. J (bottom); the goal state must encode left = E..J (top→bottom), middle = A, right = B,C,D (top→bottom). Enclose the PDDL domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
